tit.e: Togu gakushi (teacher of the classics of the Crown Prince)

sen.j: 東宮学士（とうぐうがくし）は、律令制に定められた皇太子（東宮）付きの教育官の一つである。
sen.e: Togu gakushi were one of the educational officers who served the Crown Prince (Togu) under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 皇太子の学友的存在の家庭教師で儒教を教える。
sen.e: They were tutors as sort of fellow students of the Crown Prince and taught Confucianism to him.

sen.j: 同様の官に親王の家司である文学（ふみはかせ）がある。
sen.e: An officer similar to them was a fumihakase (an official who taught Imperial prince classic Confucian writings), a Keishi (household superintendent) of Imperial prince.

sen.j: 定員二名で官位は従五位下相当。
sen.e: The regular number for Togu gakushi was two and their official court ranks were equivalent to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.e: Confucian scholars were often appointed to these posts and they sometimes worked as close advisers after the Crown Prince ascended to the throne.
